meanings.definition: A small line attached to the end of a stroke in a letter or symbol.
meanings.sent1: The book's title had elegant serifs that made the letters stand out.
meanings.sent2: I prefer fonts with serifs because they make the text easier to read.
meanings.sent3: The serif on the 't' looked like a tiny hat perched on the letter.
meanings.sent4: Her calligraphy had serifs that danced along the page like graceful swans.
meanings.sent5: The serif on the 'f' was like a delicate finishing touch to the word.
